GlobalVariables.StudyDescription: This file contains the metadata, events, and data for REDCap project "Progress bar wizard".

redcap:Surveys.title: REDCap Progress Bar Wizard v1.0
redcap:Surveys.instructions:
This utility allows users to construct an HTML progress bar by selecting colours, entering text, and modifying the width. At the top and the bottom of the form is a preview of the progress bar, which dynamically updates with any change to the configuration.

Once you have configured your progress bar, you can scroll to the end and click 'Show me the code!' to view the HTML code that you can copy and paste straight into a descriptive text field in your survey or form.

This wizard is the creation of Aidan Wilson (aidan.wilson@intersect.org.au) after a suggestion from John Liman during the 2022 A/NZ REDCap Admin Forum at Monash University, where Aidan demonstrated a few different progress bars in HTML. Many thanks to Günther Rezniczek for help with the JavaScript to create the colour pickers.

This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.
redcap:Surveys.acknowledgement:
Thank you for taking the survey.

Have a nice day!
redcap:Surveys.response_limit_custom_text: Thank you for your interest; however, the survey is closed because the maximum number of responses has been reached.

ItemDef.Name: cmagic
ItemDef.redcap:Calculation: $(document).ready(function() { global.__evalsDone || $('body').append($(document.createElement('link')).attr('rel','stylesheet').attr('href',$('#spectrumcss').text())); global.__evalsDone || $.getScript($('#spectrumjs').text(), function(){ eval('$("input[Xcol]").addClass("spectrum col");'.replace('X','name='.substr(0,5))); eval('$("input[Xcol1]").addClass("spectrum col1");'.replace('X','name='.substr(0,5))); eval('$("input[Xcol2]").addClass("spectrum col2");'.replace('X','name='.substr(0,5))); eval('$("input[Xbg_col]").addClass("spectrum bg_col");'.replace('X','name='.substr(0,5))); eval('$("input[Xfg_col]").addClass("spectrum fg_col");'.replace('X','name='.substr(0,5))); $('.spectrum').spectrum({preferredFormat:'hsl',showInput:true,showAlpha:true}); }); global.__evalsDone || eval('global.__calculate X global.calculate;'.replace('X','='.substr(0,1))); eval('global.__evalsDone X true;'.replace('X','='.substr(0,1))); global.calculate(); });

The value you provided is outside the suggested range (0 - 100). This value is admissible, but you may wish to double check it.

Question.TranslatedText: Text to display on progress bar

Rounded progress bar edges This affects the progress bar itself
Will be half the height of progress bar for circular edges
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
Rounded progress bar edges

This affects the progress bar itself

Will be half the height of progress bar for circular edges

Question.TranslatedText:
Rounded background edges This affects the full width bar that the progress bar sits on
Will be half the height of progress bar for circular edges
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
Rounded background edges

This affects the full width bar that the progress bar sits on

Will be half the height of progress bar for circular edges

Question.TranslatedText: Custom colour or bootstrap predefined colour? Predefined colours allow for striped and animated bars whereas custom colours do not allow these enhancements.
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
Custom colour or bootstrap predefined colour?

Predefined colours allow for striped and animated bars whereas custom colours do not allow these enhancements.

Question.TranslatedText: Striped? Striped progress bars are good for accessibility
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
Striped?

Striped progress bars are good for accessibility

Question.TranslatedText: Animated? This won't show up in the preview, but will work in the HTML code when pasted into a descriptive text field. Here's a small exmple:
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
Animated?

This won't show up in the preview, but will work in the HTML code when pasted into a descriptive text field. Here's a small exmple:

ItemDef.Name: col
ItemDef.redcap:FieldNote: Use the colour picker, or enter any hex, rgb(a), hsl(a) or colour name in the colour picker text entry field

Question.TranslatedText: Start End Colour {col1} {col2} Position {col1_anchor} {col2_anchor} Gradient direction {grad_degrees} Position refers to how far along the progress bar the colour is located. By default the start colour is 0 (left edge) and the end colour is 100 (right edge). Modifying these values may result in a progress bar that is almost completely one of the two colours, and then has a quick gradation to the other. Gradient direction is a degree value controlling the direction of start colour to end colour, where 0 is top-to-bottom, 90 is left-to-right, 180 is bottom-to-top and 270 is right-to-left.
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
Start End
Colour {col1} {col2}
Position {col1_anchor} {col2_anchor}
Gradient direction {grad_degrees}

Position refers to how far along the progress bar the colour is located. By default the start colour is 0 (left edge) and the end colour is 100 (right edge). Modifying these values may result in a progress bar that is almost completely one of the two colours, and then has a quick gradation to the other.

Gradient direction is a degree value controlling the direction of start colour to end colour, where 0 is top-to-bottom, 90 is left-to-right, 180 is bottom-to-top and 270 is right-to-left.

ItemDef.Name: col1
ItemDef.redcap:FieldNote: Use the colour picker, or enter any hex, rgb(a), hsl(a) or colour name in the colour picker text entry field

Question.TranslatedText: Start colour position Use this (and the next) option to weight the two ends of the gradient somewhere along the progress bar. By default, the start colour is set to the left edge (value 0) and the end colour is set to the right edge (value 100). Modifying these defaults can result in a progress bar that is mostly one colour and then has a quick gradation to the other colour. 0 = left edge 50 = middle 100 = right edge
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
Start colour position

Use this (and the next) option to weight the two ends of the gradient somewhere along the progress bar. By default, the start colour is set to the left edge (value 0) and the end colour is set to the right edge (value 100). Modifying these defaults can result in a progress bar that is mostly one colour and then has a quick gradation to the other colour.

0 = left edge
50 = middle
100 = right edge

ItemDef.Name: col2
ItemDef.redcap:FieldNote: Use the colour picker, or enter any hex, rgb(a), hsl(a) or colour name in the colour picker text entry field

Question.TranslatedText: End colour position 0 = left edge 50 = middle 100 = right edge
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
End colour position

0 = left edge
50 = middle
100 = right edge

Question.TranslatedText: Gradient direction 0 = top to bottom 90 = left to right 180 = bottom to top 270 = right to left
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
Gradient direction

0 = top to bottom
90 = left to right
180 = bottom to top
270 = right to left

ErrorMessage.TranslatedText: The value you provided is outside the suggested range (0 - 360). This value is admissible, but you may wish to double check it.
The value you provided is outside the suggested range (0 - 360). This value is admissible, but you may wish to double check it.

Question.TranslatedText: Both start and end colours, positions, and gradient direction must be defined for the preview to take effect. If you prefer, you can restore the defaults by reloading the page.
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
Both start and end colours, positions, and gradient direction must be defined for the preview to take effect.
If you prefer, you can restore the defaults by reloading the page.

ItemDef.Name: calctext

Question.TranslatedText: If you're happy with the look of your progress bar, you can get the code by clicking the button below, selecting it from the popup and copying it to your clipboard. You can then paste it anywhere you want; a descriptive text field, a section header, or elsewhere. You could even use it outside REDCap (assuming there is a world outside REDCap). Show me the code!
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: If you're happy with the look of your progress bar, you can get the code by clicking the button below, selecting it from the popup and copying it to your clipboard. You can then paste it anywhere you want; a descriptive text field, a section header, or elsewhere. You could even use it outside REDCap (assuming there is a world outside REDCap).
